dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Sanzhar Zhamalov, just appointed as the new Country Manager for Mastercard in Kazakhstan and Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sanzhar Zhamalov, just appointed as the new Country Manager for Mastercard in Kazakhstan and Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sanzhar Zhamalov appointed as the new Country Manager of Mastercard in Kazakhstan and Central Asia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, that's a huge role—covering Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, and Turkmenistan, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, that's a huge role-covering Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, and Turkmenistan, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: His area of responsibility includes Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan and Turkmenistan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And he was previously the Head of ING Bank's Representative Office in Kazakhstan, so he's got that deep financial sector background.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And he was previously the Head of I N G Bank's Representative Office in Kazakhstan, so he's got that deep financial sector background.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, Mr. Zhamalov was the Head of Representative Office of ING Bank N.V. in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and his main focus is gonna be driving business expansion across the region, strengthening ties with partner banks and government agencies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and his main focus is gonna be driving business expansion across the region, strengthening ties with partner banks and government agencies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main task of Mr. Zhamalov will be to stimulate the companys business growth in the countries of the region, strengthening cooperation with partners banks and government agencies, development new partnerships.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He mentioned he's excited to join Mastercard, especially with the payment sector growing so rapidly in Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He mentioned he's excited to join Mastercard, especially with the payment sector growing so rapidly in Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am excited to take on my new responsibilities at Mastercard. The payment sector is developing at a tremendous pace in Central Asia, and I hope that my previous experience and knowledge will benefit not only the company, but also Kazakhstan and the countries of the region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it sounds like his experience is really aligned with their goals—uh, building a sustainable digital economy there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it sounds like his experience is really aligned with their goals-uh, building a sustainable digital economy there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mastercard is actively involved in creating a sustainable digital economy in Central Asia countries. I am glad to have become a member of this professional team, said Sanzhar Zhamalov.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Rafal Trepka, the former Country Manager, is shifting to lead the Customer Solution Centre, which is their regional hub for the CIS.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Rafal Trepka, the former Country Manager, is shifting to lead the Customer Solution Centre, which is their regional hub for the C I S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rafal Trepka, former Country Manager of Mastercard Central Asia, as previously announced, will focus on leading the Mastercard Customer Solution Centre, Mastercard's regional hub in the CIS region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he expressed a lot of confidence in Zhamalov, saying he'll give additional impetus to their projects in the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he expressed a lot of confidence in Zhamalov, saying he'll give additional impetus to their projects in the region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am confident that Sanzhar will give additional impetus to our projects, and together we will continue to work to ensure that even more of Mastercards most advanced solutions and innovations are available in the region, making payments simple, secure and convenient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting how they're structuring leadership—Suleiman Sozeri, the CEO for CIS, emphasized how both roles will complement each other.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting how they're structuring leadership-Suleiman Sozeri, the C E O for C I S, emphasized how both roles will complement each other.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am sure that the work of Sanzhar Zhamalov in Central Asia and Rafal Trepka, who has extensive experience and many business connections throughout the CIS region, will bring even greater benefits to the region as a whole, help develop the digital economy and introduce Mastercard's global experience and technologies in cooperation with second-tier banks, government agencies, and private fintech companies, said Suleiman Sozeri, CEO of Mastercard in CIS.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, with Trepka's broad CIS experience and Zhamalov's Central Asia focus, they're really doubling down on regional growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, with Trepka's broad C I S experience and Zhamalov's Central Asia focus, they're really doubling down on regional growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Mastercard's involvement goes beyond payments—they're supporting micro businesses, IT exporters, even the creative industry in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Mastercard's involvement goes beyond payments-they're supporting micro businesses, I T exporters, even the creative industry in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Kazakhstan Mastercard assisting the National Bank and Government of Kazakhstan in expanding payment ecosystem and promoting Kazakhstan through the Mastercard network for the further implementation of breakthrough projects in the field of tourism, carrying out programs to support micro, small and medium-sized businesses, IT exporters and the creative industry through the development of payment and digital solutions, providing expert and technological support in the development of the national payment system and the development of human capital.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That holistic approach is key, especially when you're talking about building an inclusive digital economy across 212 countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That holistic approach is key, especially when you're talking about building an inclusive digital economy across two hundred twelve countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today, Mastercard is present in 210 countries and territories around the world, where it leverages its extensive technology platform and digital assets to build sustainable and inclusive digital economy where everyone prospects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Zhamalov's credentials are impressive too—Executive MBA from Cambridge, CFA charterholder…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Zhamalov's credentials are impressive too-Executive M B A from Cambridge, C F A charterholder...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He holds an Executive MBA from the University of Cambridge (UK), a Master's degree in International Financial Analysis from the University of Newcastle (UK) and a BSc in Financial Mathematics from Charles University (Czech Republic). Moreover, he holds the prestigious financial certificate CFA and Certificate in Company Direction from the Institute of Directors (UK).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely brings both academic rigor and practical market knowledge to the role.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely brings both academic rigor and practical market knowledge to the role.

artist_script:
HostA: Sanzhar Zhamalov, just appointed as the new Country Manager for Mastercard in Kazakhstan and Central Asia.
HostB: Oh wow, that’s a huge role—covering Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, and Turkmenistan, right?
HostA: Exactly. And he was previously the Head of ING Bank’s Representative Office in Kazakhstan, so he’s got that deep financial sector background.
HostB: Yeah, and his main focus is gonna be driving business expansion across the region, strengthening ties with partner banks and government agencies.
HostA: He mentioned he’s excited to join Mastercard, especially with the payment sector growing so rapidly in Central Asia.
HostB: And it sounds like his experience is really aligned with their goals—uh, building a sustainable digital economy there.
HostA: Meanwhile, Rafal Trepka, the former Country Manager, is shifting to lead the Customer Solution Centre, which is their regional hub for the CIS.
HostB: Right, and he expressed a lot of confidence in Zhamalov, saying he’ll give additional impetus to their projects in the region.
HostA: It’s interesting how they’re structuring leadership—Suleiman Sozeri, the CEO for CIS, emphasized how both roles will complement each other.
HostB: Yeah, with Trepka’s broad CIS experience and Zhamalov’s Central Asia focus, they’re really doubling down on regional growth.
HostA: And Mastercard’s involvement goes beyond payments—they’re supporting micro businesses, IT exporters, even the creative industry in Kazakhstan.
HostB: That holistic approach is key, especially when you’re talking about building an inclusive digital economy across 212 countries.
HostA: Zhamalov’s credentials are impressive too—Executive MBA from Cambridge, CFA charterholder…
HostB: Definitely brings both academic rigor and practical market knowledge to the role.
